README.md
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 Arduino Pin Library
2 ===
3 An easy to use Arduino library for fast digital I/O using port manipulation. Capable of simultaneous operations on multiple Pins. Supports Arduino Mega, Arduino Uno, and Arduino Leonardo. Complete documentation can be found [here](https://pin.fenichelar.com). Source code can be found [here](https://github.com/fenichelar/Pin). Common uses are listed below.
4 
5 ## Install
6 Install from the Arduino Library Manager or download the latest release [here](https://github.com/fenichelar/Pin/releases/latest).
7 
8 Import Pin Library
9 ------
10 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
11 #include <Pin.h>
12 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
13 
14 ## Create Pin Object
15 Single Pin
16 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
17 Pin myPin = Pin(5);
18 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
19 Array of Pins
20 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
21 Pin myPins[] = {6,7};
22 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
23 
24 ## Use as Input
25 Set mode to input
26 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
27 myPin.setInput();
28 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
29 Enable/disable pullup resistor
30 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
31 myPin.setPullupOn();
32 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
33 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
34 myPin.setPullupOff();
35 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
36 
37 ## Use as Output
38 Set mode to output
39 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
40 myPin.setOutput();
41 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
42 Set HIGH/LOW
43 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
44 myPin.setHigh();
45 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
46 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
47 myPin.setLow();
48 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
49 
50 ## Get Pin Info
51 Get mode (INPUT/OUTPUT)
52 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
53 myPin.getMode();
54 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
55 Get state (HIGH/LOW)
56 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
57 myPin.getState();
58 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
59 Get value (HIGH/LOW)
60 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
61 myPin.getValue();
62 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
63 
64 ## Toggle
65 Toggle mode (OUTPUT -> INPUT, INPUT -> OUTPUT)
66 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
67 myPin.toggleMode();
68 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
69 Toggle state (HIGH -> LOW, LOW -> HIGH)
70 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
71 myPin.toggleState();
72 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
73 
74 ## Simultaneous Operations on Multiple Pins
75 
76 All Pins in array must use the same DDR, PORT, and PIN registers. Look at the corresponding file in the boards directory to determine what registers each pin uses on a given board. Because this library is built for speed, the array of pins is not automatically checked to be valid for simultaneous operations. An invalid array will produce unexpected results without error, therefore it is highly recommended that the array be validated using the `checkPinGroup` function during setup.
77 
78 Import Pin library with support for simultaneous operations
79 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
80 #include <Pin.h>
81 #include <PinGroup.h>
82 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
83 Create array of Pins for simultaneous operations
84 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
85 Pin myPinGroup[] = {2,3,5};
86 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
87 Check to ensure all pins in array of pins use the same registers
88 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
89 checkPinGroup(myPinGroup) == true
90 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
91 Simultaneously set mode for array of Pins to input
92 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
93 setInput(myPinGroup);
94 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
95 Simultaneously set mode for array of Pins to output
96 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
97 setOutput(myPinGroup);
98 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
99 Simultaneously check if array of Pins are all HIGH
100 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
101 getValue(myPinGroup) == HIGH
102 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
103 Simultaneously check if array of Pins are all LOW
104 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~{.cpp}
105 getValue(myPinGroup) == LOW
106 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
